FOIA 101

A brief guide to the Freedom of Information Act

By Angela Wang

What is a public record?

Public records comprise documents created or retained by a government -- from physical papers to all manner of electronic files. If it came in contact with a government employee or government money at any point, it's probably a public record.

The types of records below can all be requested through FOIA.

  • Emails & texts
  • Telephone logs
  • Contracts
  • Photographs
  • Meeting minutes
  • Algorithms
  • Training materials
  • Receipts
  • Calendars
  • Notes & memoranda
  • Surveillance footage
  • Reports
  • Salaries
  • Military records
  • FBI files
